summary: This is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys and others coordinating logistics for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to review physical evidence in her criminal case. It details plans for evidence review at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse and a Bronx warehouse, including security protocols, required materials, and personnel assignments.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case whose defense team is scheduled to review evidence. She will be produced by the Marshals to the 500 Pearl Street courthouse for the evidence review.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the main logistical email, coordinating the evidence review plan with the FBI and providing contact information. They will field questions from the defense during the review.

connections.description: Prosecutor for the United States government coordinating the evidence review for the defendant Maxwell's case.

events.title: Start of Maxwell Evidence Review
events.description: Defense team begins reviewing physical evidence in the Maxwell case at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse. The review is scheduled to continue daily until complete.

locations: 500 Pearl Street courthouse (5th floor proffer room area)
keyFacts: A detailed logistical plan was created for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to review physical evidence, including highly confidential materials from Epstein's devices.
The evidence review was scheduled to begin on April 13, 2021, at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse, with Maxwell present under FBI and Marshal supervision.
The FBI was required to bring secure laptops, hard drives containing confidential images from Epstein's devices, and hard copy images for the defense to review.
A separate evidence review was planned for a Bronx warehouse for items not being brought to the courthouse.
The email highlights the extensive security and coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI for handling sensitive evidence in a high-profile case.
